fields.text: The Q.STEPS Biometer G/C Dual Monitoring System is intended for use with Q.STEPS Glucose and Cholesterol Test Strips with Q.STEPS Biometer G/C by healthcare professionals and home users. Q.STEPS Biometer G/C System provides a quantitative measurement of Glucose and Cholesterol in whole blood from the fingertips. The Glucose measurements are used in helping the management of carbohydrate metabolism disorders including diabetes mellitus, idiopathic hypoglycemia and pancreatic islet cell tumors. Cholesterol measurements are used in the management of disorders involving excess cholesterol in the blood, lipid and lipoprotein metabolism disorders.
fields.device_trade_name: Q.STEPS Biometer G/C Dual Monitoring System
fields.intended_use: The Q.STEPS Biometer G/C Dual Monitoring System is intended for use with Q.STEPS Glucose and Cholesterol Test Strips with Q.STEPS Biometer G/C by healthcare professionals and home users. Cholesterol measurements are used in the management of disorders involving excess cholesterol in the blood, lipid and lipoprotein metabolism disorders.

fields.text: RNAlc Control for Bayer DCA2000 and DCA2000+ Analyzers is intended to be used to monitor and evaluate the analytical performance of the Bayer DCA 2000 and DCA 2000+ Analyzers that measure HbAlc. The use of quality control materials is indicated as an objective assessment of the precision of methods and techniques in use and is an integral part of good laboratory practice. The two levels of controls allow performance monitoring within the clinically important range.
fields.device_trade_name: RNAlc Hemoglobin Alc Control for Bayer DCA2000 and DCA2000+ Analyzers
fields.intended_use: RNAlc Control for Bayer DCA2000 and DCA2000+ Analyzers is intended to be used to monitor and evaluate the analytical performance of the Bayer DCA 2000 and DCA 2000+ Analyzers that measure HbAlc. The use of quality control materials is indicated as an objective assessment of the precision of methods and techniques in use and is an integral part of good laboratory practice. The two levels of controls allow performance monitoring within the clinically important range.

fields.text: The BD FACSCanto system with BD FACSCanto clinical software when used with the BD FACS Sample Prep Assistant II is intended for use as an in vitro diagnostic device for identification and enumeration of lymphocyte subsets in human cells in suspension using a lyse / no-wash sample preparation method for flow cytometry. This is the same intended use as previously cleared for the BD FACSCanto system with BD FACSCanto clinical software. Immunophenotyping in clinical laboratories, using previously cleared IVD assays for flow cytometry that utilize the lyse no-wash sample preparation method. Immunophenotyping of lymphocyte subsets including CD3+CD8 +, CD3CD4 [4], CD3-CD 16 [+] and/or CD56 +, CD3YCD19 +, and CD3 +. For in vitro diagnostic use. For use with or without the BD FACS Sample Prep Assistant II.
fields.device_trade_name: BD FACSCanto system with BD FACSCanto clinical software
fields.intended_use: The BD FACSCanto system with BD FACSCanto clinical software when used with the BD FACS Sample Prep Assistant II is intended for use as an in vitro diagnostic device for identification and enumeration of lymphocyte subsets in human cells in suspension using a lyse / no-wash sample preparation method for flow cytometry. This is the same intended use as previously cleared for the BD FACSCanto system with BD FACSCanto clinical software. Immunophenotyping in clinical laboratories, using previously cleared IVD assays for flow cytometry that utilize the lyse no-wash sample preparation method. For use with or without the BD FACS Sample Prep Assistant II.

fields.text: C.f.a.s. PUC is for use in the calibration of quantitative Roche methods on Roche clinical chemistry analyzers as specified in the enclosed value sheet. Precinorm ® PUC/ Precipath ® PUC is for use in quality control by monitoring accuracy and precision for the quantitative methods as specified in the enclosed value sheet
fields.analyte_biomarker: Albumin, Total protein, Immunoglobulin G, Creatinine, Immunoglobulin A, Immunoglobulin M

fields.text: AlloMap Heart Molecular Expression Testing is an In Vitro Diagnostic Multivariate Index assay (IVDMIA) test service, performed in a single laboratory, assessing the gene expression profile of RNA isolated from peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC). AlloMap Heart Testing is intended to aid in the identification of heart transplant recipients with stable allograft function who have a low probability of moderate/severe acute cellular rejection (ACR) at the time of testing in conjunction with standard clinical assessment. Indicated for use in heart transplant recipients: 15 years of age or older, At least 2 months (>=55 days) post-transplant
fields.intended_use: AlloMap Heart Molecular Expression Testing is an In Vitro Diagnostic Multivariate Index assay (IVDMIA) test service, performed in a single laboratory, assessing the gene expression profile of RNA isolated from peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC). AlloMap Heart Testing is intended to aid in the identification of heart transplant recipients with stable allograft function who have a low probability of moderate/severe acute cellular rejection (ACR) at the time of testing in conjunction with standard clinical assessment. Indicated for use in heart transplant recipients: 15 years of age or older, At least 2 months (>=55 days) post-transplant

fields.text: To outline the steps involved in the analytical phase of generating results for 11-Deoxycortisol in a CLIA-certified laboratory, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and reliability of results for clinical use.
fields.purpose: To outline the steps involved in the analytical phase of generating results for 11-Deoxycortisol in a CLIA-certified laboratory, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and reliability of results for clinical use.
reagents: Mobile phase solvents (e.g., acetonitrile, water, methanol)
fields.quality_control: Perform analysis of three levels of quality control with each batch. Acceptable limits for quality control are set based on the manufacturer’s recommendations and verified by the laboratory. If quality control fails, repeat analysis or troubleshoot the LC-MS/MS system.
fields.interpretation_guidelines: Results are automatically transmitted to the Laboratory Information System (LIS) and reviewed by the technologist. Verify results before releasing to ensure values are consistent with quality control and patient conditions. Report any critical values following the laboratory's critical values protocol.

fields.text: To provide a detailed and standardized protocol for the analysis and reporting of 11-deoxycorticosterone levels in serum samples. Ensure consistency, accuracy, and reliability of test results.
fields.purpose: To provide a detailed and standardized protocol for the analysis and reporting of 11-deoxycorticosterone levels in serum samples. Ensure consistency, accuracy, and reliability of test results.
reagents: Specific reagents and solvents as per manufacturer's protocol for sample preparation
fields.quality_control: Run quality control samples (low, medium, and high concentrations) along with patient samples to ensure assay performance. Document any quality control failures and repeat the analysis if necessary. Routine maintenance and calibration of the HPLC or LC-MS/MS should be performed to ensure optimal operation.
fields.interpretation_guidelines: Reference intervals for 11-Deoxycorticosterone should be based on validated literature or established laboratory data. Potential interferences from other steroids should be considered.

fields.text: To provide a detailed protocol for the confirmation of Carboxy-THC in meconium samples, including the analytical steps required to generate reliable and accurate results following sample preparation and extraction.
fields.procedure_name: Analytical Phase for 11-NOR-DELTA-9-TETRAHYDROCANNABINOL-9-CARBOXYLIC ACID (CARBOXY-THC) CONFIRMATION IN MECONIUM
fields.purpose: To provide a detailed protocol for the confirmation of Carboxy-THC in meconium samples, including the analytical steps required to generate reliable and accurate results following sample preparation and extraction.
reagents: Extraction media (e.g., solid phase extraction cartridges)
fields.quality_control: Use two levels of internal quality control for each batch of samples. In case of QC failure, halt analysis and investigate the cause. Retest samples once the issue is resolved. Document all QC measures and corrective actions taken.
fields.interpretation_guidelines: Refer to established cutoff levels for Carboxy-THC positivity as per laboratory guidelines.

fields.text: To confirm the presence of 11-NOR-DELTA-9-TETRAHYDROCANNABINOL-9-CARBOXYLIC ACID (Carboxy-THC) in meconium for forensic purposes, ensuring a proper chain of custody, reliable and accurate results, consistent documentation, and clear accountability for specimen handling and analysis.
fields.purpose: To confirm the presence of 11-NOR-DELTA-9-TETRAHYDROCANNABINOL-9-CARBOXYLIC ACID (Carboxy-THC) in meconium for forensic purposes, ensuring a proper chain of custody, reliable and accurate results, consistent documentation, and clear accountability for specimen handling and analysis.
fields.quality_control: Run quality control samples, including a blank, a negative control, and a positive control. Ensure all instrument calibrations fall within manufacturer’s specified ranges. Verify that quality control samples meet reference criteria. Troubleshoot any deviations and reanalyze samples if necessary.
fields.interpretation_guidelines: Confirm the presence or absence of Carboxy-THC. Document results: include specimen identifier, quantitative values, and analyst’s initials. Transmit verified results to Laboratory Information System (LIS)/electronic health record (EHR).

fields.text: To outline the procedure for the analytical phase of generating results for 11-Deoxycortisol in serum samples, ensuring accurate and reliable test results that comply with clinical laboratory standards.
fields.purpose: To outline the procedure for the analytical phase of generating results for 11-Deoxycortisol in serum samples, ensuring accurate and reliable test results that comply with clinical laboratory standards.
reagents: Calibrators and controls specific to 11-Deoxycortisol measurement
fields.quality_control: Internal Quality Control: Run three levels of control (low, medium, high) with each batch of samples to ensure the assay's accuracy and precision. Document all control results. If controls fail, do not report patient results until the issue is resolved. External Quality Control: Participate in relevant proficiency testing programs and document the results as required. Calibration and Validation: Perform calibration verification annually or after major instrument maintenance. Validate new reagent lots by comparing results with previous lots using patient samples.
fields.interpretation_guidelines: Results are automatically transmitted to the LIS and must be reviewed and verified by the technologist. Reference Intervals: Refer to site-specific reference intervals for 11Deoxycortisol. Critical Results: Follow site-specific guidelines for reporting critical values. Document any actions taken in response to critical results.
